/getting-started.name: Getting Started
/getting-started.description: Get started with basic information, concepts and tutorials.

itemList.name: Tutorials
itemList.description: Get started with basic information, concepts and tutorials.

/getting-started/tutorials.name: Tutorials
/getting-started/tutorials.description: Get started with basic information, concepts and tutorials.

/core-tutorial.name: Core Tutorial
/core-tutorial.description: Learn to use Nx with this core tutorial where you will learn about all its main feature with a real project.

/angular-standalone-tutorial.name: Angular Standalone Tutorial
/angular-standalone-tutorial.description: Learn to use Nx with this Angular tutorial where you will learn about all its main feature with a real project.

/node-server-tutorial.name: Node Server Tutorial
/node-server-tutorial.description: Learn to use Nx with this Node Server Tutorial where you will learn about all its main feature with a real project.

/core-features.name: Core Features
/core-features.description: Learn the core features of Nx with in depth guides.

itemList.name: Run Tasks
itemList.description: Learn about the various ways you can use Nx to run tasks in your workspace.

itemList.name: Cache Task Results
itemList.description: Learn how to define cacheable tasks, how to fine-tune with inputs and outputs, where the cache is stored and much more.

itemList.name: Use Remote Caching
itemList.description: Learn how to enable remote caching s.t. you don't just benefit locally from it but also in CI.

itemList.name: Distribute Task Execution
itemList.description: Learn how to efficiently distribute tasks across machines to take full advantage of parallelization. Nx Cloud has a built-in DTE mechanism which makes this a trivial task.

itemList.name: Explore the Graph
itemList.description: Nx uses a graph behind the scenes to optimize your operations. You can also visualize and use the graph to better understand your workspace structure. Learn more in this guide.

itemList.name: Automate Updating Dependencies
itemList.description: Learn how Nx provides automated update scripts to help you keep your workspace, tooling and framework dependencies up to date.

itemList.name: Enforce Module Boundaries
itemList.description: Learn how to avoid dependency hell and scale a codebase by imposing constraints on your projects using the module boundary lint rule.

itemList.name: Integrate with Editors
itemList.description: Learn about Nx Console, an extension for VS Code and WebStorm.

itemList.name: Plugin Features
itemList.description: Learn what is a plugin, the different type of plugins and how to create one.

/core-features/automate-updating-depende.description: Learn how Nx provides automated update scripts to help you keep your workspace, tooling and framework dependencies up to date.

/core-features/enforce-module-boundaries.description: Learn how to avoid dependency hell and scale a codebase by imposing constraints on your projects using the module boundary lint rule.

/core-features/integrate-with-editors.description: Learn about Nx Console, an extension for VS Code and WebStorm.

/core-features/plugin-features.name: Plugin Features
/core-features/plugin-features.description: Learn what is a plugin, the different type of plugins and how to create one.

itemList.name: One main Storybook instance for all projects

itemList.description: This guide explains how migrate from older versions of Storybook which used a custom webpack.config.js to the new Storybook 6.3+ which uses the webpackFinal property in the main configuration and the Nx React Addon.

itemList.name: React: Upgrading to Storybook 6
itemList.description: This guide explains how you can upgrade your Storybook from versions 5.3 and below to Storybook 6, for React projects.

/deprecated/storybook/angular-storybook-.name: Angular: Information about the Storybook targets
/deprecated/storybook/angular-storybook-.description: This document explains the role of the storybook and build-storybook targets in Angular projects with a Storybook configuration, and specifically which executors are used for them.

/deprecated/storybook/angular-browser-ta.name: Angular: The browserTarget
/deprecated/storybook/angular-browser-ta.description: This document explains the role of the browserTarget in Angular projects with a Storybook configuration, and how the Storybook executors use it.

/deprecated/storybook/migrate-webpack-fi.name: Angular: Storybook Migration to webpackFinal
/deprecated/storybook/migrate-webpack-fi.description: This guide explains how migrate from older versions of Storybook which used a custom webpack.config.js to the new Storybook 6.3+ which uses the webpackFinal property in the main configuration.

/deprecated/storybook/upgrade-storybook-.name: Angular: Upgrading to Storybook 6
/deprecated/storybook/upgrade-storybook-.description: This guide explains how you can upgrade your Storybook from versions 5.3 and below to Storybook 6, for Angular projects.

/deprecated/storybook/migrate-webpack-fi.name: React: Storybook Migration to webpackFinal and the Nx Addon
/deprecated/storybook/migrate-webpack-fi.description: This guide explains how migrate from older versions of Storybook which used a custom webpack.config.js to the new Storybook 6.3+ which uses the webpackFinal property in the main configuration and the Nx React Addon.
